content.description: Start low and left of the bolt line in the depression for full effect.  Traverse right down low then flow up using balance moves on bolt line. Crux movements just below bolt.

True start slightly left under bolt 1 with high heel hook on buldge. Climb to ledge and clip shared bolt and anchors staying left at anchors.

 Alternate start to right of buldge in depression. Use pockets and side pulls until you traverse left to bolt line. Makes start less muscular but should be about the same grade.
content.location: At ship rock, look for low buldge under the left side of an obviously large ledge that could support a whale

climbs.name: She is very gorgeous to me

content.description:
Sit start with right hand in two one finger pockets, left hand in good slot. Use arete and face to top out.

 Part of effort to put up some more easy low commitment boulders for beginners.
content.protection: Pad, landing is slanted with loose rock

content.description: Decide left or right sequence on big pockets to ledge. Make a couple easy moves to anchors.

content.location: The aft of Ship Rock. Start on log and straight up left side.

content.description: This route is an obvious severely overhanging prow a bit past the Recycler area. Was shown to me by Jim and Josh, and I tried several times over a couple of years while visiting family in the area. Felt mid-5.13 until I finally unlocked the beta and sent.  Originally graded 12d/13a, I have decided to just call it 13a (15 May 2019).
content.protection: 2 bolts, stick clip the anchors from the 2nd bolt to toprope the crux. Rappel rings at anchor.

content.description: Look for good pockets down low and utilize side pulls and bomber ledges up high.
content.location: In between Beached Whale and Narwal. Avoid using big platform on Beached Whale (unless of course you want the super nice rest spot)

content.description: Start either in pockets under the ledge or out right following the thin crack (more difficult), climb up through pockets to surmount the ledge, elegantly or like a beached whale, then continue using a shared bolt and anchors finishing to right of anchors.
content.location: Under right side of big ledge on Ship Rock

content.description: Start low and left and traverse over to the arete. Then work your way up the arete and take advantage of the great holds when you can find them.
content.location: Arete on far right side of Ship Rock (next to gulley that separates Ship Rock from Mike's Wall)

content.description: Marked by a short, severely overhanging prow (this is where you'll find Minute Man 5.13a). Just around the corner to the right you'll find a fun group of moderate climbs in the 5.8- 5.10 range.
